alert.note: Alert for Fergus (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 06 at 2:09PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM MDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Hydrologic flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...A portion of central Montana, including the following county, Fergus. * WHEN...Until 200 PM MDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 204 PM MDT, emergency management reported flooding in the advisory area. Minor flooding is already occurring. - Any additional rainfall will worsen ongoing flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lewistown, Denton, Winifred, Moore, Grass Range, Roy, Fergus, Giltedge, Hilger, Christina, Suffolk, Heath, Forestgrove, Glengarry, Danvers, Fred Robinson Bridge, Valentine and Coffee Creek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
